intro: Rinxostylis, commonly known as the coastal fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Restionaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in coastal regions where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with wiry stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences, and the genus includes several species adapted to harsh, maritime environments. Rinxostylis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
